author: Jonathan W.
title: Hands-On Marketing in Addis Ababa
description: Enormous untapped potential in Ethiopia! Many devs and entrepreneurs are unaware of Catalyst. How can we encourage them to submit proposals?

assessments.note: I think that currently, catalysts can get more proposers from more developed countries, given the percentage of educated/not educated people. (my personal perspective). It is a good idea to spread the news, increase the awareness but I think there are better projects who are approaching to this more effectively.
assessments.reply: This defies the principal of "Citizenship" in the Community Moderation Guidelines: The point of decentralization is ensuring that everyone has a level playing field to collaborate, regardless of where they were born, what they believe, and how they identify.

assessments.note: This initiative sounds really good and the fact that the team has already started working on it, means they are passionate about reaching as many people from Addis Ababa and helping them discover the potential of Project Catalyst.

This proposal directly addresses the challenge by 'injecting vitality and diversity' into the Cardano / Project Catalyst community.  It presents live 'Hands-on' events in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia focused on several tech hubs and established institutions, such as a local University.   Additionally, this proposal is an example of a 'multi platform proposer outreach campaign' because it includes social media ads, posters and flyers, and traditional media.  I feel this proposal will bring new members (developers / entrepreneurs / academics) into the community, increase media coverage and increase the quality of proposals.

The proposal appears to be a small scale localised initiative that targets an appropriate market. The team are coordinating their program with further activities scheduled for Ethiopia. The proposal meets the challenge.
The physical presence to advertise Catalyst in Addis Ababa for onboarding proposers and innovators can bring serious players to Project Catalyst.

This proposal is well prepared and presented.  The self assessment was completed and the proposal was updated to include insights and collaborations from the community.  There is a reasonable budget.  The definition of success is clear and achievable and aligned with the KPI of the campaign.

The proposal team seem quite motivated and have the necessary experience required to deliver on this proposal. The plan is reasonably straightforward and does not hold too many risks to be achieved. I would like to see further information about all team members and what they bring to the project.

The primary proposer is a serving U.S diplomat as per his Linkedin reference and is planning for a part-time commitment from other members for 3000 U.S Dollars. The follow-up and onboarding of proposers by a person employed full-time by another organization may not be ideal.
there is a good proposed metric how to check if it works - but the aim is very low  - only 3 new proposals, as far as I understood.
The proposal contains all the needed information, the budget is very reasonable, the measures of success are realistic. I see no reason why it would not succeed.

The lead proposer demostrates in the comments that he is community oriented and dedicated to this project.  The project is 'on-going' and, if funded, will increase it's scope and effectiveness.  There is a growing team of implementers and is connected to several existing networks in the pivotal city of Addis Ababa.  There are metrics and goals by which to measure success.  I believe that this team and this project will bring real, 'hands - on' value to our community.
It would be good to have information on how many outreach events this proposal is targeting and how many people there are at each. It is however a relatively small funding request.

The information was sufficient to allow insight into what the team are trying to achieve. It would have been good to see a mock up of the flyers that are being touted. In addition the budget would have benefitted by having greater detail especially in regard to the Part-time salaries requested.
The proposal is for media & social media advertisement. The returns on this advertisement complaint is difficult to audit since it depends hugely on quality, timing and various other factors.

solution:
Engage community via information sessions at local tech hubs  
Hang posters and hand out flyers with specifics on upcoming Catalyst rounds
experience:
We're doing this already (see pics)  
Connections across business and developer communities in Addis Ababa  
10 years experience in Ethiopia
